title: Karen Read Lifetime movie premiering in January
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Entertainment The Lifetime adaptation is one of several in the works, and the first to dramatize Read’s case outside of a docuseries.
Karen Read and her lawyers address the media in front of Norfolk Superior Court after the mistrial was declared in 2024.

Suzanne Kreiter / The Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin December 16, 2025 | 3:51 PM 1 minute to read Karen Read is getting the movie treatment next month with the release of a new ripped-from-the-headlines Lifetime flick, “Accused: The Karen Read Story.

title: ‘It’s financial suicide to remain here’: Here’s why readers say they’re leaving Mass. in 2026
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Readers Say Nearly two-thirds of Boston.
com readers said they are planning to leave the state due to affordability concerns.
A view of townhouses on Alexander Street in Uphams Corner.

title: Karen Read attorney Alan Jackson now representing Nick Reiner in parents’ murder
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Reiner is suspected of killing his parents, famed filmmaker Rob Reiner and photographer Michele Singer Reiner.
Defense attorney Alan Jackson.

Greg Derr/The Patriot Ledger, Pool, File By Abby Patkin December 16, 2025 | 3:29 PM 1 minute to read Alan Jackson, the noted California attorney who won Karen Read’s acquittal this year, is now representing Nick Reiner, the man suspected of killing his parents, filmmaker Rob Reiner and photographer Michele Singer Reiner.

title: Bruins claim defenseman Vladislav Kolyachonok off waivers from Stars
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins Kolyachonok appeared in 11 games with the Stars this season.
Kolyachonok is an intriguing add on Boston's blue line.

(AP Photo/Jason Redmond) By Conor Ryan December 16, 2025 | 3:25 PM 1 minute to read The Boston Bruins bolstered some of their D-corps depth on Tuesday, plucking blueliner Vladislav Kolyachonok off waivers from the Dallas Stars.

title: Healey demands ICE stop using Hanscom for flights
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News At least 114 ICE flights have departed from Hanscom Field in Bedford this year, according to a human rights group that tracks flight data.

title: Cancelation of naturalization ceremonies is ‘disturbing to the utmost degree,’ Wu says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Immigrants from certain "high-risk" countries on the verge of gaining their citizenship are being turned away by federal officials.

Boston City Council President Ruthzee Louijeune, Executive Director of Project Citizenship Gail Breslow, and Boston Mayor Michelle Wu hold a press conference in Faneuil Hall to address the cancelation of naturalization ceremonies for some immigrants.

title: Cade Cunningham explained why he ‘loves’ competing against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "They’re a championship team; they’ve got a championship identity.
Play a great brand of basketball, so it’s always a test for us coming in.
" Cade Cunningham (AP Photo/Charles Krupa The NBA season is still young, but at this moment it’s the Detroit Pistons who sit atop the Eastern Conference standings with a league-best 21-5 record.
